Invest it in a vanilla JS obsession, at which point you can breeze through courses on frameworks like this one.

results.content:
(2021-9-9) NEW comers NOTE & course thanks.

1)	Summary (I finished the whole course!): 
a.	0 complaints. 
b.	0 regret paying $.
c.	Agreed with what some other classmates mentioned:
i.	Stephen's Angular class is the best out of several others.
ii.	Coverage of RxJs is even better & more than the dedicated classes.
d.	Well deserved 5-star. Cannot recommend more!

2)	Stephen.
a.	Seems no longer appears for 1 yr. NOT a critical matter since the class content is very self-contained.
b.	He is still a great teacher / presenter. 
c.	He clearly explained useful or hard concepts step-by-step, which is beneficial to me who am totally new to Angular.

3)	Projects.
a.	All are working, either typed along the AV (& a few edit) or download from source code. 

4)	Class.
a.	Content & problem were well thought & presented.
b.	Theory + practice. 
c.	Showing & discussing bad designs

5)	A few Angular/TS updates.
a.	Dig into Q&A & the critical issues have got solutions -> seek & found.

6)	About the 'unfinished landing page project':
a.	Stephen humbly claims only 50% finished.
b.	He finished 2.8 out of 4 features (pagination was partially done). & indeed the last feature (fetch tech news) is identical to the 3rd (fetch world news) -> So I would say the project is 90%.
c.	Most importantly, I was able to learn a lot more RxJs & review Angular.
d.	This project is a big +++, instead of discount in any sense (as long as you are not stubborn to only consider a good thing must be 100% done).

results.content:
The course is suitable for beginners. Stephen explains difficult concepts very thoroughly (but at the same time repetitive). RxJS's explanation was decent. In the Typescript section, designed specifically for this course you'll learn about types, inference, what interface is, and how to implement one, that's it! In another 7hr TS section (which is taken from Stephen's another course), you'll be working on 2 projects,   again learning interfaces and what abstract classes are.

All projects that you will build (except maybe email-client and half-complete last project) are simple. There is absolutely no mention of how to perform testing, despite claims in the description. The course seems to be complete: no new material or Q&A answers since 2020, the last project is unfinished (50% complete). No mentions of FormBuilder in 'forms' section.

results.content:
Great course, but a few complaints that prevent me from rating full 5 stars.

The good:
- Explains complex topics very well with diagrams
- Little projects are fun/interesting.
- Covers RxJS better than even other dedicated RxJS courses
- Great job explaining how to structure apps with Modules. Other courses touch on this later on by refactoring, but here it's taught at the beginning (although this could be very difficult to very new Angular learners)
- Nice "intro" section to Typescript, plus "deep dive" to Typescript.

The "meh":
- I think a total newb to Angular would find it hard to follow, as early on the course goes into very advanced topics way before some of the basics.
- The last section (project) was left unfinished
- The "deep dive" for Typescript is great, but it's very disconnected from the Angular course. I realize it's taken from Stephen's full Typsscript course, but there should be an intro video explaining this.
- Some more advanced topics don't necessarily need 30 mins to explain the inner workings. Just show how it's done and move on. :)
- Stephen seems to not be active in the comments (anymore)

results.content:
Hands down the best Angular course you're going to find. I won't lie, I'm only about 10 hours in but I've already learned more than from 30+ hours of other courses. Stephen is a fantastic instructor.

PLUS it's Angular 8.

PLUS Stephen speaks very clear English...no accent! YAY!

Edit: I'm about halfway through now and while I still feel this is the best Angular course you're going to find I do have a complaint and it's serious enough to drop my score down to 4 stars from 5 stars.

I REALLY dislike Stephen's tendency to teach you to do something the wrong way...or several wrong ways, before teaching you the right way.  I learned from a very young age playing sports that you will play how you practice. If you spend time practicing something the wrong way...there's a good chance you will do it wrong when it comes time to right your own code. I guess the thought is show them what not to do so they know but...in reality it just makes things way more confusing than they need to be and it honestly ends up wasting a LOT of time. This course could be somewhere around 20% shorter if Stephen didn't spend time teaching you the wrong way to do everything...or at least didn't spend SO MUCH TIME on it.

Edit: Additionally, there are now two incomplete projects included...we were promised one would be completed shortly after the course was released but we still haven't seen it yet. Therefore, I'm dropping my rating down to 3 stars until Stephen updates the course with at least one of the projects. If he completes both projects I will update this again back to 5 stars as that will outweigh my previous complaints.

WOW!! This course is EXACTLY, actually more than, what I was hoping for!! There are soooo many good things about it. 

1. Stephen Grider is engaging and keeps my attention.  
2. The course examples are realistic enough to illustrate the key principles, but simple enough to get done.
3. Stephen Grider offers different design options as he discusses the problems and the pros and cons of each approach and technique.
4. He covers not just Angular, but how to utilize a lot of different resources and tools. The little work site for rx operators, for example, is really useful.
5. I have logged three comments / questions. Stephen replied w/in a day to each of them.
Really, can't say enough about the quality and of both the content and the instruction.  It's been like a good book, I can't tear myself away.

I am about 27% complete and I chose to leave a rating because I am enjoying it so much. I like Stephen's teaching style and the breadth he covered. Really enjoyed the section on RxJS. I am leaving a 4-star rating because I don't understand the rationale of using Bulma or Semantic UI over Bootstrap. I found it distracting. 

Read some comments about the instructor not being available to answer questions. I never ever feel the need to reach out to an instructor while taking this type of MOOC. As long as the material has good coverage (which is the case here), I like to get stuck sometimes and figure out the answer myself. 

Stephen - if you're reading this -> Please consider putting up a section on NgRx. Even if you create a new course, I will happily add that to my learning. Really enjoying this one!

results.content:
I bought many courses from Udemy, and I think this course and some other courses taught by Stephen Grinder are some of the best.  I'm a full stack .Net Developer currently using what I'm  learning on this course at work.  And you read it right, I do mean what I'm learning because I haven't completed this course yet.

I have probably 5 other Angular courses on my list, but all of them are just showing you how they are building an application but they don't really teach you.  Of course you can always use what they teach you at work, but could you really answer all the questions they ask you in a code review at work?  If an software architect ask you why you wrote a piece of code or explain to them how the codes work, you should be able to answer that.  

And this course could also help you on job interviews.  You'll be surprised how you know much better than any Angular interviewer.  For example an interviewer asked me how to do 2 ways.  When I asked him if it is for reactive form or template form , he wasn't able to answer that.  So I answered here's how you would do it if you are using Reactive Form and I also gave him the answer for Template Form. Guess what?  He was looking for [(ngModel)] as the answer.  The answer for Reactive form was foreign for him.

I'm not surprised about that, because most of the related answer that you would find on stackoverflow.com and some other developer sites always give the same answer no matter if you are using Reactive Form or Template Form.

results.content:
As React developer I was always stay far away from Angular, because I was afraid of these unknown things that happens out there: Dependency Injection, RxJS, Angular bindings, etc. and I had no idea how much time I'll spend to understand these things.

Also I always was wondering, should I learn it when I already have rich React background, is it possible to get deep understanding of both of these worlds and fit it in brain. And Stephen proves that this is totally possible.

Also Stephen knows how teach complex things to newbies in particular field, and I totally trust him, he proved this in his previous courses, so I feel more than ambicious and excited to learn Angular now.

Thank you, Stephen!

results.content:
BEST... COURSE... EVER... Buy it as many times as you need it. you will NEVER regret it. 
I have previously bought other Angular courses from OTHER instructors. The all sucked (Specially than Maximilian one :puke: ) but Stephen's is the BEST one out there, BY FAR!

Why is that? Let me tell you:
- You can EASILY tell Stephen works in real-world applications
- He has A LOT of knowledge. A LOT
- Stephen's voice is easy to hear to
- App development is easy to follow
- Stephen teaches with: 1) His own Words - 2) Live Diagrams - 3) Clear code (Yes, all three)
- He teaches slow enough for beginners and fast enough for experienced developers
- His courses do not suffer from video cuts due to lack of preparation
- This course also includes many of his typescript course, so its TWO COURSES FOR ONE
- I learned a lot from his courses (This is not the first one I bought) and I made a lot of money thanks to it.
- I am loyal to all of his courses, for ever

Disclaimer: I do not know him, I never spoke to him, I was not paid to do this review. I just acknowledge such a magnificent instructor. Plus I asked for refund to buy this course 'cuz they all sucked.
